newsitem.title: TURKEY: Bids sought for new Turkish forex bonds.
newsitem.headline: Bids sought for new Turkish forex bonds.

text.p: The Turkish treasury asked banks on Thursday for bids by Friday for its new offer of foreign currency denominated bonds, officials said.
They said the bonds would have a three-year maturity with interest rates payments to be made at six-month intervals.

The interest rate on the bonds will be London Interbank Offered Rate plus 2.6 percent for the dollar-denominated bonds and Frankfurt Interbank Offered Rate plus two percent for the mark denominated bonds.
The value date of the bonds will be "a day in November", one official said.
The minimum amount of participation will be $10 million and 15 million marks.
The treasury sold $1.12 billion of similar bonds on September 25.
